restructureit.refactorings.processors

Class PushDownField

  • java.lang.Object
    • spoon.processing.AbstractProcessor<spoon.reflect.declaration.CtField<?>>
      • restructureit.refactorings.processors.PushDownField
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    spoon.processing.FactoryAccessor, spoon.processing.Processor<spoon.reflect.declaration.CtField<?>>

    public class PushDownField
extends spoon.processing.AbstractProcessor<spoon.reflect.declaration.CtField<?>>
    Performs the refactoring Push down field. It moves a field down to the subclasses classes that use it. Reference: https://www.refactoring.com/catalog/pushDownField.html

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<spoon.reflect.declaration.CtClass<?>> classesUsingField
      List to hold all classes that use field in read or write operations.
      private static int timesApplied
      Total number of times the pull up refactoring was performed.
      private double toleranceLevel
      Tolerance level which indicates the maxiumum percentage of subclasses should use the field for it to be considered for moving down.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PushDownField()

      Checks if subclasses inherited method containing a field access.
      static int getTimesApplied() 
      boolean isToBeProcessed(spoon.reflect.declaration.CtField<?> candidateField)
      Determines if this field should be pushed down.
      void process(spoon.reflect.declaration.CtField<?> candidateField)
      Moves the candidate field up to its class's parent class.
      static void resetTimesApplied()
      Resets times applied back to zero.
